Japan is in serious shit at this point as their main demographic issue is declining birthrate. One of the main factor is the hellish working hours especially those who work in offices that extended to 7-12 hours per days. Also there's barely less days for them to have relaxation at all. Because of this, those who work have less time when it comes to love and domestic livelihood. Not enough time to raise a family. This have been an ongoing issue that the previous Prime Minister Abe is vocal about this. But seems to me that none of his words reached out to the Japan business worlds who's workaholic conglomerates don't care about anything to some upgraded or change policy for their employees working hours. At this rate, Japanese are going extinct from this severe attitude.
